headers.subject: [tosdr:2605] Flattr uses cookies

html:
Once you start using the Flattr Site, we collect information about your activity on Flattr-enabled sites via cookies in order to recognise you. We do this so you can avoid having to re-identify yourself manually when you visit the sites you have chosen to support. [...] We encode our cookies so that only we can interpret the information stored in them. You can decline our cookie if your browser permits but doing so will interfere with the use of the Service.

http://flattr.com/privacy

Title: Flattr tracks your activity via cookies

Topic: track

Summary: Flattr collects information on your use of their site by using cookies that only Flattr can identify. This also includes information about any button clicks for any items that you choose to Flattr.

Score: 80 (mediocre)

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: Flattr uses cookies
text:
>
> Once you start using the Flattr Site, we collect information about your 
> activity on Flattr-enabled sites via cookies in order to recognise you. We 
> do this so you can avoid having to re-identify yourself manually when you 
> visit the sites you have chosen to support. [...] We encode our cookies 
> so that only we can interpret the information stored in them. You can 
> decline our cookie if your browser permits but doing so will interfere with 
> the use of the Service.


http://flattr.com/privacy

Title: Flattr tracks your activity via cookies

Topic: track

Summary: Flattr collects information on your use of their site by using 
cookies that only Flattr can identify. This also includes information about 
any button clicks for any items that you choose to Flattr.

Score: 80 (mediocre)
